channel.title: Please Help Me
channel.description:
[b]Please Help Me.[/b] Hey, welcome to my thread. I've got errors, very strange errors. I beleive Nirvana had these earlier and he/she fixed them.. Gah, I have no idea what's wrong.. Here are the errors;
[code]client.java:16116: 'else' without 'if' else if(useItemID == 436 && atObjectID == 2781 & & playerLevel[13] >= 0) // Using Tin ore on a furnace. Produces 1 Bronze bar. ^ client.java:16127: 'else' without 'if' else if(useItemID == 440 && atObjectID == 2781 & & playerLevel[13] >= 5) // Using Iron ore on a furnace. Produces 1 Iron bar. ^ client.java:16138: 'else' without 'if' else if(useItemID == 453 && atObjectID == 2781 & & playerLevel[13] >= 10) // Using Coal ore on a furnace. Produces 1 Steel bar.
^ client.java:16149: 'else' without 'if' else if(useItemID == 447 && atObjectID == 2781 & & playerLevel[13] >= 20) // Using Mithril ore on a furnace. Produces 1 Mithril bar. ^ client.java:16160: 'else' without 'if' else if(useItemID == 449 && atObjectID == 2781 & & playerLevel[13] >= 45) // Using Adament ore on a furnace. Produces 1 Adament bar. ^ client.java:16171: 'else' without 'if' else if(useItemID == 451 && atObjectID == 2781 & & playerLevel[13] >= 75) // Using Runite ore on a furnace. Produces 1 Runite b ar. ^ client.java:16184: 'else' without 'if' else if(useItemID == 4830 && atObjectID == 5284) // Bone grinding ^ 7 errors Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Thanks.

item.title: Please Help Me
item.dc:creator: @mrdek11 mrdek11
item.description:
@mrdek11 wrote:

Heh, if you read his explanation with how he got the code, and read the bottom of my post, you’ll see we both did/said the same thing, but just glad you got it fixed

[quote=“mrdek11, post:24, topic:108318”]oh! with a second look at your code, I found it.
Either remove the brackets under each addItem line, or add a bracket before each else line (except the first) that should fix it.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.description:

mrdek11:

Aww all he did was give you a code for what I told you to do, dont I get any thanks?

What you said was nothing like what Eh Pretty Easy provided me with. Thanks anyway.

Lol I found it out when I was looking at the code, because there must only be one { in the start and } in the end but there was { after addItem so I just removed it.

item.title: Please Help Me
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Here it is, fixed.

[code] // This part is simple Smelting.

                           	else if(useItemID == 436 && atObjectID == 2781) // Using Tin ore on a furnace.  Produces 1 Bronze bar.
			{
                            startAnimation(899);
			addItem(2349, 1);
			sendMessage("You make a Bronze bar.");
			pSay("Ouch!  It's roasting hot!");
                            addSkillXP((25*playerLevel[13]), 13);
                            deleteItem(436,getItemSlot(436), 1);
			}

                           	else if(useItemID == 436 && atObjectID == 2781 && playerLevel[13] >=  0) // Using Tin ore on a furnace.  Produces 1 Bronze bar.
			{
                            startAnimation(899);
			addItem(2349, 1);
			sendMessage("You make a Bronze bar.");
			pSay("Ouch!  It's roasting hot!");
                            addSkillXP((25*playerLevel[13]), 13);
                            deleteItem(436,getItemSlot(436), 1);
			}

                           	else if(useItemID == 440 && atObjectID == 2781 && playerLevel[13] >=  5) // Using Iron ore on a furnace.  Produces 1 Iron bar.
			{
                            startAnimation(899);
			addItem(2351, 1);
			sendMessage("You make an Iron bar.");
			pSay("Ouch!  It's roasting hot!");
                            addSkillXP((50*playerLevel[13]), 13);
                            deleteItem(440,getItemSlot(440), 1);
			}

                           	else if(useItemID == 453 && atObjectID == 2781 && playerLevel[13] >=  10) // Using Coal ore on a furnace.  Produces 1 Steel bar.
			{
                            startAnimation(899);
			addItem(2353, 1);
			sendMessage("You make a Steel bar.");
			pSay("Ouch!  It's roasting hot!");
                            addSkillXP((75*playerLevel[13]), 13);
                            deleteItem(453,getItemSlot(453), 1);
			}

                           	else if(useItemID == 447 && atObjectID == 2781 && playerLevel[13] >=  20) // Using Mithril ore on a furnace.  Produces 1 Mithril bar.
			{
                            startAnimation(899);
			addItem(2359, 1);
			sendMessage("You make a Mithril bar.");
			pSay("Ouch!  It's roasting hot!");
                            addSkillXP((100*playerLevel[13]), 13);
                            deleteItem(447,getItemSlot(447), 1);
			}

                           	else if(useItemID == 449 && atObjectID == 2781 && playerLevel[13] >=  45) // Using Adament ore on a furnace.  Produces 1 Adament bar.
			{
                            startAnimation(899);
			addItem(2361, 1);
			sendMessage("You make a Adament bar.");
			pSay("Ouch!  It's roasting hot!");
                            addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[13]), 13);
                            deleteItem(449,getItemSlot(449), 1);
			}

                           	else if(useItemID == 451 && atObjectID == 2781 && playerLevel[13] >=  75)
			{
                            startAnimation(899);
			addItem(2363, 1);
			sendMessage("You make a Runite bar.");
			pSay("Ouch!  It's roasting hot!");
                            addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[13]), 13);
                            deleteItem(451,getItemSlot(451), 1);
			}

			//  The "Runite Smelting" above was the last.[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me
item.dc:creator: @mrdek11 mrdek11
item.description:
@mrdek11 wrote:

There isn’t one in the code you provided, only else ifs, but come to think of it, there’s probably an original if at the top of whatever section your working in.
All I can tell, is that your errors are there, because somewhere, (it’s saying here) there is an else without an if.
oh! with a second look at your code, I found it.
Either remove the brackets under each addItem line, or add a bracket before each else line (except the first) that should fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me

item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

It wont work. There is already an if statement.

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me
item.dc:creator: @mrdek11 mrdek11
item.description:
@mrdek11 wrote:

The errors (else without if,) are there because you are using an else statement, without first an if.
That’s like randomly saying:

or else we could go to the movies!
Everyone else would be wondering "or else? what was our other option?" You must first use an if.
We could go to the store, or else we could go to the movies!
then people/java will understand you. Remove the first else, even if that doesn't fix your error, you won't get it fixed without removing it.

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

[quote=“mrdek11, post:20, topic:108318”]Remove the else from the first if and you should be good.
If not, remove all the elses, in this case elses aren’t required, as its impossible to somehow manage to use to items on the same object at the exact same time.[/quote]

No. Because if I removed the else from the 1st statement, I would get 100 errors I think. That after all, is after the if statement. You’ve given me a good idea though.
